text: This is a list of lawmen and prime ministers of the Faroe Islands. The Faroese term løgmaður (plural: løgmenn) literally means "lawman" and originally referred to the legal function of lawspeaker. This old title was brought back into use to refer to the head of government after the islands obtained Home Rule in 1948. In recent decades the Faroese government has started using "Prime Minister" as the official English translation of løgmaður, reflecting the increased autonomy of the islands. This translation does not apply to the pre-1816 office, only the modern leaders of the Faroese government. ==List of Løgmenn== ===Løgmenn as lawmen ( 1000–1816)=== Many of the earlier holders of this position are not known. {| class="wikitable" |- !
